intro: Astroloma microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved astroloma, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of tiny, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. It is a low-growing shrub that thrives in full sun and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its unique floral structure and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
